data.title: Pasargadae
data.text: Pasargadae /p'srgdi/ (from Old Persian "Pra-gad", "protective club" or "strong club"; Modern Persian: "Psrgd") was the capital of the Achaemenid Empire under Cyrus the Great (559530 BC). Today it is an archaeological site located just north of the town of Madar-e-Soleyman and about to the northeast of the modern city of Shiraz. It is one of Iran's UNESCO World Heritage Sites. It is considered to be the location of the Tomb of Cyrus, a tomb previously attributed to "Madar-e-Soleyman", the "Mother of Solomon".
